definition: imperial chariot/(fig.) emperor/(polite) you
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
surname Jia
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
we are honored by your presence

sentences.english: It is but a day's journey from this place, and it waits for thy coming.
sentences.chinese: 戒指在离这里不过一日行程的地方，恭候您的大驾。

sentences.english: The Prince of Darkness does not condescend to such cheap drudgery.
sentences.chinese: 这种下贱的差使，根本用不着劳“黑暗之王”的大驾。

sentences.english: We had to wait almost an hour before he condescended to see us.
sentences.chinese: 我们等了几乎一小时他才屈尊大驾来见我们。

sentences.english: Please don't go out your way.

definition: we are honored by your presence
(polite) excuse me for not going out to meet you
to inconvenience/to trouble (sb with a request)
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
excuse me
failure to meet/(humble language) I'm sorry not to have come to meet you personally
to look forward to sth/to wait respectfully
how could one dare?/I don't deserve such praise
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
please forgive me
to not deserve (one's good fortune etc)
(polite) thank you for your trouble (used when asking a favor or after having received one)
to greet/to go out to meet
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
Your presence brings light to my humble dwelling/see also 蓬蓽生光|蓬荜生光[peng2 bi4 sheng1 guang1]
to do sb the honor (of attending etc)/to put in an appearance/to show up
